hero-journey.name: Ruyi Jingu Bang
hero-journey.shortDescription: Sun Wukong's magical staff that can change size at will, weighing 17,550 pounds

hero-journey.name: Ambrosia
hero-journey.shortDescription: Divine food of the Olympian gods, conferring immortality, healing, and preservation from decay

hero-journey.name: Ba
hero-journey.shortDescription: Egyptian soul or personality, the unique individual essence that travels freely after death

hero-journey.name: Cinnabar
hero-journey.shortDescription: Sacred red mineral central to Daoist alchemy and immortality practices

hero-journey.name: Dionysian Rites
hero-journey.shortDescription: Ecstatic worship ceremonies of Dionysus featuring wine, music, dance, and trance states seeking divine possession and liberation

hero-journey.name: Duat
hero-journey.shortDescription: Egyptian underworld, realm of the dead ruled by Osiris, where souls journey and face judgment

hero-journey.name: Eleusinian Mysteries
hero-journey.shortDescription: Secret initiation rites held annually at Eleusis, promising initiates a blessed afterlife through the mysteries of Demeter and Persephone

hero-journey.name: Elixir of Life
hero-journey.shortDescription: Alchemical potion granting immortality through Daoist transformation practices

hero-journey.name: Elysium
hero-journey.shortDescription: Paradise within the Underworld where heroes and the righteous enjoy eternal bliss

hero-journey.name: Golden Fleece
hero-journey.shortDescription: Magical golden fleece from the flying ram Chrysomallos, object of Jason's quest and symbol of authority and kingship

hero-journey.name: Kleos
hero-journey.shortDescription: Heroic glory and renown won through great deeds, granting immortality through lasting fame

hero-journey.name: Mead of Poetry
hero-journey.shortDescription: Divine mead granting the gift of poetry and wisdom, created from the blood of Kvasir and claimed by Odin through cunning

hero-journey.name: Medusa
hero-journey.shortDescription: One of the three Gorgon sisters with serpent hair whose gaze turns viewers to stone

hero-journey.name: Mugwort
hero-journey.shortDescription: Sacred herb of protection, prophetic dreams, and magical sight, used in seidr practices and shamanic journeying

hero-journey.name: Mummification
hero-journey.shortDescription: Sacred Egyptian ritual of preserving the dead through embalming and wrapping to ensure successful journey through the Duat and eternal life in the afterlife

hero-journey.name: Peach of Immortality
hero-journey.shortDescription: Divine fruit from Xi Wangmu's garden that grants immortality and cosmic longevity

hero-journey.name: Staff of Moses
hero-journey.shortDescription: Divine rod wielded by Moses to perform miracles and lead the Israelites out of Egypt

hero-journey.name: Wu Xing
hero-journey.shortDescription: Five Elements theory - the cyclical system of Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, and Water

hero-journey.name: Yin and Yang
hero-journey.shortDescription: Fundamental duality of complementary opposites that constitute all existence

great-mother.name: Ash Tree
great-mother.shortDescription: Sacred tree species of Yggdrasil, the World Tree, from which the first man was created and symbolizing cosmic connection

great-mother.name: Brahma
great-mother.shortDescription: The creator god of the Hindu Trimurti, who brings forth the universe from the cosmic waters

great-mother.name: Br√≠singamen
great-mother.shortDescription: Freyja's legendary necklace of unparalleled beauty, forged by four dwarves and symbol of fertility, beauty, and desire

great-mother.name: F√≠or-Feis

great-mother.name: Lotus
great-mother.shortDescription: Sacred flower symbolizing creation, rebirth, and the sun's daily resurrection

great-mother.name: Makara
great-mother.shortDescription: Aquatic creature with crocodile/elephant features, vahana of Varuna and Ganga, symbol of water and fertility

great-mother.name: Midgard
great-mother.shortDescription: The realm of humans, the Middle Earth, surrounded by ocean and connected to Asgard by the rainbow bridge Bifrost

great-mother.name: Nile River
great-mother.shortDescription: Sacred river of Egypt, source of life and fertility, manifestation of divine providence

great-mother.shortDescription: Annual Theban festival celebrating the sacred marriage of Amun and Mut, renewing the pharaoh's divine power and cosmic order

great-mother.name: Pomegranate
great-mother.shortDescription: Sacred fruit of the underworld, symbol of death, rebirth, fertility, and marriage

great-mother.name: Takamagahara (Plain of High Heaven)
great-mother.shortDescription: The Plain of High Heaven, celestial realm where the kami dwell and where creation began

great-mother.name: Yellow River
great-mother.shortDescription: Sacred river, cradle of Chinese civilization, and cosmic waterway guarded by river deities

divine-child.name: Crete

divine-child.name: Lotus
divine-child.shortDescription: Sacred flower symbolizing creation, rebirth, and the sun's daily resurrection

divine-child.shortDescription: Sacred fruit of the underworld, symbol of death, rebirth, fertility, and marriage

divine-child.shortDescription: Sacred evergreen tree associated with death, rebirth, and the runes, used for divination and magical purposes

underworld-journey.name: Duat
underworld-journey.shortDescription: Egyptian underworld, realm of the dead ruled by Osiris, where souls journey and face judgment

underworld-journey.shortDescription: Secret initiation rites held annually at Eleusis, promising initiates a blessed afterlife through the mysteries of Demeter and Persephone

underworld-journey.name: Yew
underworld-journey.shortDescription: Sacred evergreen tree associated with death, rebirth, and the runes, used for divination and magical purposes

world-tree.name: Yggdrasil
world-tree.shortDescription: The World Tree, an immense ash tree connecting the Nine Realms and serving as the cosmic axis of Norse mythology

world-tree.name: Ash Tree
world-tree.shortDescription: Sacred tree species of Yggdrasil, the World Tree, from which the first man was created and symbolizing cosmic connection

world-tree.name: Bilva

world-tree.name: Elder

world-tree.name: Ogham

world-tree.name: Yew
world-tree.shortDescription: Sacred evergreen tree associated with death, rebirth, and the runes, used for divination and magical purposes
